lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/gigachad.gigachad.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run gigachad.gigachad.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

Gigachad, a handsome personal task manager!
>Remember to use DateTime in the following format: **yyyy-MM-dd HHmm**
Here are the tasks in your list:
> Marks task "2." from your `list` as complete
> Unmarks task "2." from your `list` as complete
> Gigachad will output all tasks that contains the keyword "pasta"
> i.e. only task 3 from the above example
To add deadlines: deadline <task> /by <due date>. Format: yyyy-MM-dd HHmm
To add events: event <task> /from <start> /to <end>. Format: yyyy-MM-dd HHmm
To list all your todos: list
To mark your todos as complete: mark <task number (find using list)>
To unmark your todos as complete: unmark <task number (find using list)>
To delete your todos: delete <task number (find using list)>
To search for todos with keywords: find <keyword>

return "Hello! I'm gigachad!\n What can I do for you?";

return "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + task;

* Displays message indicating that task has been marked incomplete.

<AnchorPane maxHeight="-Infinity" maxWidth="-Infinity" minHeight="-Infinity" minWidth="-Infinity" prefHeight="600.0" prefWidth="400.0" stylesheets="@../css/main.css" xmlns="http://javafx.com/javafx/17" xmlns:fx="http://javafx.com/fxml/1" fx:controller="MainWindow">
<TextField fx:id="userInput" layoutY="558.0" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="324.0" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="1.0" AnchorPane.leftAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="76.0" />

<Button fx:id="sendButton" layoutX="324.0" layoutY="558.0" mnemonicParsing="false" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="41.0" prefWidth="76.0" text="Send" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="1.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="0.0" />

<ScrollPane fx:id="scrollPane" fitToWidth="true" hbarPolicy="NEVER" hvalue="1.0" prefHeight="557.0" prefWidth="400.0" vvalue="1.0" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="43.0" AnchorPane.leftAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="0.0" AnchorPane.topAnchor="0.0">
* Unit tests for the {@link Command} class.
* This test suite validates both the success and failure paths of
* all commands supported by the gigachad application, such as:
* Stub class for {@link TaskList} to expose its internal task list directly.
* Stub class for {@link Storage} to avoid side effects while still allowing file persistence.
* Stub class for {@link Ui} to simplify interaction checks.
* Verifies that executing a "list" command on an empty task list throws a {@link GigachadException}.
Command command = new Command("list", "list", new String[] {});
* Verifies that adding a todo, deadline, and event task
* successfully persists them to storage in the expected format.
Command commandTodo = new Command("todo", "todo borrow book",
Command commandDeadline = new Command("deadline", "deadline return book /by 2025-09-09 1900",
* Verifies that a "todo" command with no description throws a {@link GigachadException}.
Command command = new Command("todo", "todo", new String[] { "todo" });
* Verifies that a "deadline" command with an invalid date format throws a {@link GigachadException}.
Command command = new Command("deadline", "deadline task /by not-a-date",
* Verifies that an "event" command missing required fields throws a {@link GigachadException}.
Command command = new Command("event", "event something /from onlyStart",
* Verifies that a "find" command with no keyword throws a {@link GigachadException}.
Command command = new Command("find", "find", new String[] { "find" });
* Verifies that a "mark" command with an invalid task number throws a {@link GigachadException}.
Command command = new Command("mark", "mark 5", new String[] { "mark", "5" });
* Verifies that the "help" command returns a help message containing expected usage instructions.
Command command = new Command("help", "help", new String[] { "help" });
* Verifies that an invalid command returns an error message to the user.
Command command = new Command("nonsense", "nonsense", new String[] { "nonsense" });
* Tests both saving tasks to file and loading tasks back from storage,
* including handling of corrupted input data.

public DeadlineStub(String description, LocalDateTime by, boolean done) {
* Stub Event task used for testing.
public EventStub(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to, boolean done) {
* Tests that tasks saved to storage are written in the correct format.
* Tests that {@link Storage#initStorage()} correctly creates a new empty file
* if it does not already exist.
assertTrue(filePath.toFile().exists(), "File should be created if not present");
assertTrue(tasks.isEmpty(), "Task list should be empty for a new file");
* Tests that {@link Storage#initStorage()} loads tasks from an existing file correctly.
assertEquals(3, tasks.size(), "Should load all tasks from file");
* Tests that {@link Storage} loads tasks from an existing file correctly, even if parent directories are missing
assertTrue(filePath.toFile().exists(), "File should be created even if parent directories are missing");
assertTrue(tasks.isEmpty(), "Task list should be empty for a new file with missing parent directories");
